column4: hi peeps i have installed a deb package that belongs to debian and not to ubuntu how can i remove it?
hi peeps
i have installed a deb poackage from debian and i causes problem with the installation
how can i uninstall it
doesn't apt-get remove work for u
no it didnt
well it works but when i want to use apt-get install , i get the following message
what was the app that u installed
privoxy
but privoxy is available in ubuntu
why did u install debian version
i was searchin in the debian name but when i rechecked i found out that there was one
so i somehow uninstalled it and went with apt-get install ...
but i always get the same problem
u mean u installed privoxy using apt-get and not dpkg
yes
trying purging the package
what is the exact command of that?
it deletes configuration file of the package
and now i use apt-get install?
do give it a try. i hope it works
ok working on it
